meanings.definition: A device for measuring force, torque, or power
meanings.sent1: The dynamometers in the lab helped us measure how much force was needed to move the object.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used dynamometers to check the power of the engine.
meanings.sent3: The dynamometers at the gym were so strong, they could even measure the force of a sneeze!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a dynamometer, always measuring the strength of her willpower.
meanings.sent5: The dynamometers clicked and whirred as they calculated the power output of the machine.

meanings.sent1: The dynamometers on the factory floor were used to gauge the mechanical power of the machines.
meanings.sent2: Engineers rely on dynamometers to accurately measure mechanical power in various systems.
meanings.sent3: The dynamometers had a party and measured who could generate the most mechanical power on the dance floor!
meanings.sent4: His voice was a dynamometer, projecting mechanical power that resonated through the room.
meanings.sent5: The dynamometers hummed as they assessed the mechanical power output of the engine.

meanings.definition: Tools for determining the power output of an engine
meanings.sent1: The dynamometers in the garage were essential tools for checking the power output of the engine.
meanings.sent2: Mechanics use dynamometers to ensure the engine is performing at its peak power output.
meanings.sent3: The dynamometers decided to go on strike until the engine promised to increase its power output!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a dynamometer, revealing the true power output of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The dynamometers beeped as they displayed the power output readings of the engine.
